Package de.gnwi.mfsim.model.peptide.base

Class AminoAcid

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.gnwi.mfsim.model.peptide.base.AminoAcid
  • public final class AminoAcid
extends java.lang.Object
    Class which represents a single amino acid.
    Author:
    Andreas Truszkowski

    • Constructor Detail

      • AminoAcid

        public AminoAcid​(java.lang.String aName,
                 java.lang.String anOneLetter,
                 java.lang.String aThreeLetterCode,
                 java.lang.String aSpices,
                 java.lang.String aChargeSettings)
          throws DpdPeptideException
        Creates a new instance.
        Parameters:
        aName - Name of the amino acid.
        anOneLetter - One letter code of the amino acid.
        aThreeLetterCode - Three letter code of the amino acid.
        aSpices - Spices describing gthe amino acid in particle notation.
        aChargeSettings - String defining the charge settings for this amino acid. Definition: (AAAA BBBB ? CCCC : DDDD) - AAAA: Target group in the amino acid (see ChargeType class) - BBBB: The pKs-value - CCCC: Protonated particle - DDDD: Unprotonated particle
        Throws:
        DpdPeptideException - DpdPeptideException

      • AminoAcid

        public AminoAcid​(java.lang.String anAminoAcidDefinition,
                 AminoAcidsUtility anAminoAcidsUtility)
          throws DpdPeptideException
        Creates a new instance.
        Parameters:
        anAminoAcidDefinition - Amino acid definition
        anAminoAcidsUtility - Amino acids utility
        Throws:
        DpdPeptideException - DpdPeptideException

      • setChargeSettings

        public void setChargeSettings​(java.lang.String aChargeSettings)
                       throws DpdPeptideException
        Sets the charge setting of current amino acid.
        Parameters:
        aChargeSettings - Line notation: ChargeType pKs ? protonatedParticle : deprotonatedParticle;
        Throws:
        DpdPeptideException - DpdPeptideException

      • getOneLetterCodeCharged

        public java.lang.String getOneLetterCodeCharged​(double aPH)
        Gets the charged one letter code for given amino acid depending on given pH-value. Thereby the amino acid will be treated as free.
        Parameters:
        aPH - given pH-value
        Returns:
        One letter code with charge arguments of current amino acid.

      • getOneLetterCodeCharged

        public java.lang.String getOneLetterCodeCharged​(double aPH,
                                                SidechainBehaviour aSidechainBehaviour,
                                                boolean anIsTerminalCBound,
                                                boolean anIsTerminalNBound)
        Gets the charged one letter code for given amino acid depending on given pH-value.
        Parameters:
        aPH - given pH-value
        aSidechainBehaviour - Behaviour of the side chain (free, bound, ignore)
        anIsTerminalCBound - Is amino acid bound over the terminal C-group
        anIsTerminalNBound - Is amino acid bound over the terminal N-group
        Returns:
        One letter code with charge arguments of current amino acid.

      • isValidChargeArgument

        public boolean isValidChargeArgument​(java.lang.String aChargeArgument)
        Checks whether given charge argument is valid for current amino acid.
        Parameters:
        aChargeArgument - Given charge argument
        Returns:
        True if argument is valid.

                                          throws DpdPeptideException

        Throws:

      • getBackboneParticle

        public java.lang.String getBackboneParticle()
        Returns the backbone forming string. Per definition it is the first particle.
        Returns:
        Gets the backbone forming string. Per definition it is the first particle.

      • getChargedSpicesForTesting

        public java.lang.String getChargedSpicesForTesting​(double aPH,
                                                   SidechainBehaviour aSidechainBehaviour,
                                                   boolean anIsTerminalCBound,
                                                   boolean anIsTerminalNBound)
        Gets the charged particle Spices of this amino acid. NOTE: This method is only used for test cases.
        Parameters:
        aPH - pH-Value
        aSidechainBehaviour - Sets the behaviour of the side chain (free, bound, ignore).
        anIsTerminalCBound - True if the terminal C amino bond exists
        anIsTerminalNBound - True if the terminal N amino bond exists
        Returns:
        Spices with charged particles.

      • getChargedSpices

        public java.lang.String getChargedSpices​(java.lang.String aChargeArgument)
                                  throws DpdPeptideException
        Gets the charged Spices depending on given charge argument for this amino acid.
        Parameters:
        aChargeArgument - A charge argument (S+C-N+, ...)
        Returns:
        Charged Spices
        Throws:
        DpdPeptideException - DpdPeptideException

      • getChargedSpices

        public java.lang.String getChargedSpices​(java.lang.String aChargeArgument,
                                         boolean anIsFirstAminoAcid,
                                         boolean anIsLastAminoAcid,
                                         boolean anIsDisulfideBond)
                                  throws DpdPeptideException
        Gets the charged Spices depending on given charge argument for this amino acid.
        Parameters:
        aChargeArgument - A charge argument (S+C-N+, ...)
        anIsFirstAminoAcid - True: Amino acid is first amino acid, false: Otherwise
        anIsLastAminoAcid - True: Amino acid is last amino acid, false: Otherwise
        anIsDisulfideBond - True: Amino acid is in disulfide bond, false: Otherwise
        Returns:
        Charged Spices
        Throws:
        DpdPeptideException - DpdPeptideException

      • isSingleParticleSpices

        public boolean isSingleParticleSpices()
        Returns if amino acid is represented by single-particle Spices.
        Returns:
        True: Amino acid is represented by single-particle Spices, false: Otherwise
